lexUnit.name: below.prep

corpus.description: Wall Street Journal Texts from the PropBank Project
corpus.name: PropBank

lexUnit.definition: FN: in or at a lower place than; under

sentence.text: When their changes are completed , and after they have worked up a sweat , ringers often skip off to the local pub , leaving worship for others below .
In that time more than 1.2 million jobs have been created and the official jobless rate has been pushed below 17 % from 21 % .
A 14 % inflation rate dropped below 5 % .
The street-lamps lining the promenade on the right bank glittered in the waters below the bridge where a flotilla of ghostly swans floated in the current .
As if the verglas was n't enough , there 's a concrete snowfield below the wall .
Below my room there was a narrow passage between the cottage and the house .
Below the window a crocodile of children in striped caps marched across the booking hall .
The biggest anomaly is the residential Park district of Nottingham , which consists of high-class , extensive housing but is right in the centre of the town , below the castle .
The rabbits are much more likely to be below ground after a snowfall , since they become very much more vulnerable on the surface with their cover blotted out and their feeding areas restricted .
These plants float on the surface with their roots hanging below the water .
The larvae of the cicadas that sit shrilling on trees spend their lives below ground sucking sap from roots .
High on a mountain we paused and I looked down on Lough Nafooey , a lake lying far below us .
Below her was the corpse of a woman .
Opaque scummy floods lapped only a metre below her feet ; a foul smell made her nauseous .
Far below me the sea was making its lacework on the water and flinging wreaths of gold on the shore .
To his right he could see the panorama of the docks spread out below him .

Examples are noted below and in chapter 5 .
For a fuller explanation see paragraph 17-02 , below .
See also Chapter 19 below for discussion of other similar cases .
THE STREET below was quiet as ever .
The barn floor below was covered in strands of hay and there was an old baler parked in the middle .
The children 's room is below mine and I can see clothes strung from the ceiling , shoes flung beneath the bed , blankets cast aside .
Instead she walked as fast as she could towards the river , past the mean little houses below the cathedral .
It served as excuse for a quick survey of the choppy water below .
Sunlight sought out the gaps and flickered over the new-green fields far below .
He looked down at the river bed below him .
He looked out of the aeroplane window down at the warm blue sea below .
At half-past ten , the sound of voices below the library window indicated that the first lesson of the day was over and that coffee was about to be served .
The man below had heard it too .
Directly below her were some tiny creatures crawling over the surface .
Cut off a piece of plant just below the place where the leaves join the stem .

There were also tunnels with an electric light-railway to whisk the leadership away in the event of danger even here deep below the ground .
There below you , so far away that it might be in Derbyshire , was a single toytown rooftop .
The wood down there , below the water line , was spongy and rotten : she could see it crumbling away in his hands .
The track levelled out , the glen widened , and there below us was the bay .
Mr Anthony said : ` He really did not appreciate what was down below the bridge . "
Down below , as far as the eye could see , the hills and valleys were covered in trees .
Down below , some fishermen are working on their boat to prepare for sea .
The snorting smelly smoke-blowing beast was miles away down below somewhere .
Druid 's Bottom was a long way below them : a doll 's house with tall chimneys , tucked in a fold of the valley as if in the crook of an elbow .
The creature was right below her , and if it looked up
A dizzyingly long way below lay a long , deep arc of white-powder sand .

She was right below her window now , gazing up those steep granite walls .
You are now a vertical mile below the rim and the rocks have been dated to the immense age of 2000 million years .
The fire is burning at temperatures up to 500C in the honeycomb of mine tunnels 150 metres below the surface .
Three hours later I came across Mark huddled underneath a small buttress about 50 metres below the summit of Les Courtes .
The sea was far below and the view terrific .
` The rest of you get back below . "
They move out , quickly consume what they need and are soon back below ground with the minimum of delay .
